document.title: Documenting Projects
document.paragraph:
EiffelEnvision provides a means to document, in HTML, all types of projects created for EiffelEnvision in Visual Studio .NET 2003. requirements2Requirements The only requirement of the integrated HTML documentation generation is to have the project you would like documentation generated for be compiled. As long as the project has been built, documentation can be generated for it. Note: The documentation generated by EiffelEnvision is an Application Programming Interface (API) documentation set for use by other Eiffel or EiffelEnvision projects. Due to the complexities of resolving multiple inheritance and generics, the interfaces generated in the compiled assembly, by the Eiffel for .NET compiler, will be different from those interfaces generated in the documentation.
When referencing an EiffelEnvision project as a eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/adding_references/precompiled_libraries.xmlprecompiled project from another EiffelEnvision project, the documented interfaces will match the interfaces provided in the precompiled library. generating_documentation2Generating Documentation To generate documentation for a built EiffelEnvision project, select the Project Only, Generate Documentation context menu item from the corresponding project node, located in the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfSolutionExplorerDialog.htmSolution Explorer. Alternatively, select the corresponding project node and select Project, Generate Documentation from the main menu.
Provided the requirements have been met to generate a project's documentation, the HTML documentation generation dialog will appear and will immediately begin to generate the selected project's documentation. You may cancel the documentation generation at any time by clicking on the Cancel button.
The HTML documentation generator will generate documentation only for project-specific source files that are reachable from the project's eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/build.xmlroot_classRoot Class and eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/build.xmlcreation_routineCreation Routine. If the specified eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/general.xmloutput_typeOutput Type for the project does not require a eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/build.xmlroot_classRoot Class or a eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/build.xmlcreation_routineCreation Routine, then documentation will be generated for all project-specific Eiffel classes. Note: Non project specific Eiffel classes (i.e. those not located in the project folder or in any of its subfolders) will not be included in the HTML documentation generation.
Upon successful generation of the HTML documentation, EiffelEnvision will open the root documentation HTML file in the Visual Studio .NET HTML editor for your review. All of the generated HTML and associated stylesheets are located in your project's bin\configration_name\documentation subfolder, where configration_name is the name of the active project configuration. These files may be edited, at your own discretion, in or outside of the Visual Studio .NET IDE. Warning: Any editions will be overwritten if the documentation is generated at a subsequent time. also_see2Related SectionsSee Also:eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/adding_references/precompiled_libraries.xmlPrecompiled Librarieseiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/index.xmlConfiguring Projectseiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/build.xmlBuild Property Pageeiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/precompiled.xmlPrecompiled Property Page
